meanings.definition: Capable of being violated or broken
meanings.sent1: The fragile glass was violably shattered by the strong wind.
meanings.sent2: The lock on the door was violably broken by the intruder.
meanings.sent3: The rule about no running in the hallway was violably ignored by the mischievous students.
meanings.sent4: Her trust in him was violably shattered when he betrayed her.
meanings.sent5: The delicate flower was violably crushed under the heavy boot.

meanings.definition: In a manner that can be infringed upon or disregarded
meanings.sent1: She spoke violably about the importance of honesty in relationships.
meanings.sent2: The contract was violably breached by the dishonest company.
meanings.sent3: He danced violably around the truth, trying to avoid admitting his mistake.
meanings.sent4: The rules of the game were violably bent to favor the home team.
meanings.sent5: The boundaries set by the teacher were violably crossed by the unruly students.
